ender3.notes: =========================================================================== ============================ TH3D Configuration =========================== =========================================================================== ONLY UNCOMMENT ONE PRINTER AT A TIME!!! IF YOU HAVE MULTIPLE MACHINES FLASH THEM ONE AT A TIME. UNCOMMENT MEANS REMOVING THE // IN FRONT OF A #define XXXXXX LINE. DO NOT USE AUTO BUILD MARLIN WITH OUR FIRMWARE - UNINSTALL IT FROM VSCODE BEFORE USING IF YOU HAVE ISSUES COMPILING. If you have a 512K CPU please read the notes in the platformio.ini file for details on compiling for these chips. Most boards regardless of the CPU will work as-is but if you have issues with the board flashing the firmware you may have to change the default_envs value as noted in platformio.ini. GD32 CPU Notes If you have a GD32 CPU you no longer need to change to a GD32 environment as the STM32 one work with those chips. If you converted a NEO or V2 printer to the 12864 LCD make sure to enable the ENDER3_12864_LCD_KIT option that is lower in the config section. =========================================================================== *********   CREALITY PRINTERS W/V4.X.X BOARD - F103/F303 CPU   *********** =========================================================================== ------------------------------ V4.2.2 Board -------------------------------

examples: //REQUIRES TH3D LCD KIT AND DUAL CABLE LCD ADAPTER BOARD

v42xTmc220xDrivers.notes: V4.2.2 TMC Driver Settings - Uncomment if you have TMC drivers on a 4.2.2 Board to set driver timings

ender6NofilamentSensor.notes: Ender 6 - Filament Sensor Override If you have issues with your filament sensor on the Ender 6 uncomment the below option to disable it.

ender6TmcxyA4988zeDrivers.notes: Ender 6 - Mixed Stepper Drivers If you have the newer revision of the Ender 6 board that uses TMC drivers on the XY and A4988 on the ZE axis, uncomment below to enable correct firmware settings.

ezoutEnable.notes: ------------------------------ Upgrade Settings ------------------------------- EZOut Filament Sensor Kit - LCD Header Connection If you are using our EZOut filament sensor kit please follow the install guide and then uncomment the #define EZOUT_ENABLE line below.

ezoutEnableJ1.notes: EZOut Filament Sensor Kit - J1 Plug Connection If you are using our EZOut filament sensor kit please follow the install guide and then uncomment the #define EZOUT_ENABLE_J1 line below.

cr10sStockfilamentsensor.notes: Creality CR-10S Series Filament Sensor Connect the stock sensor to the "J1" port and uncomment the below line to enable the filament sensor.

cr10Oem.notes: EZABL Probe Mounts - Uncomment the mount you are using for your EZABL to enable EZABL support in the firmware.

examples: // Mounts to the stock CRTouch bracket

ender5NewLeadscrew.notes: Ender 5 - Leadscrew Setting If you have the new Ender 5/5 Pro Model that has the new 800steps/mm Z leadscrew uncomment the below option to set the correct steps/mm

ender5PlusEzabl.notes: Ender 5 Plus ONLY ABL Settings By default the Ender 5 Plus comes with a BL Touch. Enabling the ENDER5_PLUS_EZABL or ENDER5_PLUS_NOABL will override the BL Touch setting If you are using the stock BL Touch with a non-stock mount enable the CUSTOM_PROBE line above and enter the offsets below for the new mount.

ender6LdoXy.notes: Ender 6 - LDO 0.9 Motor Kit Settings If you have upgraded to the 0.9 degree LDO motor kit for your Ender 6, uncomment the below line to set the XY steps needed.

ezneo220.notes: EZNeo Settings If you are using an EZNeo strip on your printer, uncomment the line for what strip you are using. Specify your IO pin below as well as this board does not have a dedicated NEOPIXEL header on it.

neopixelPin.notes: EZNeo Manual IO Pin Setting If you have the EZNeo wired with your own 5V power provided, specify the pin used below.

ezablPoints.notes: Probing Grid Points - If you want more or less EZABL probe points change the number below, use odd numbers. Total points is # times #.

ablUbl.notes: CHOOSE ABL_UBL OR  DEFAULT IS ABL_BILINEAR

probingSteppersOff.notes: Probing Steppers Off - This will cycle the XYE stepper motors during probing to reduce interference from them. When using this do NOT touch the X or Y during probing as they will not be locked.

customEsteps.notes: #define NOZZLE_TO_PROBE_OFFSET { 10, 10, 0 } =========================================================================== ******************** Extra Features and Tweaks **************************** =========================================================================== EXTRUDER SETTINGS ------------------------------- Use to set custom esteps and/or reverse your E Motor direction if you are installing an extruder that needs the direction reversed. If you reversed the wiring on your E motor already (like the Bondtech Guide says to do) then you do not need to reverse it in the firmware here.  Example EStep Values For Common Extuders: TH3D Aluminum Extruder ------  95 ESteps Micro Swiss DD Extruder ----- 130 ESteps LGX/LGX Lite/MS NG Extruder - 400 ESteps TH3D Tough Extruder V2 ------ 407 ESteps TH3D Tough Extruder V1 ------ 410 ESteps Bondtech BMG Extruder ------- 415 ESteps Creality Sprite Extruder ---- 425 ESteps LDO Orbiter/Sherpa Mini ----- 690 ESteps  If you want to change the Esteps for your printer you can uncomment the below line and set CUSTOM_ESTEPS_VALUE to what you want - USE WHOLE NUMBERS ONLY This option sets the esteps from the CUSTOM_ESTEPS_VALUE line below. If you need to reverse the e motor direction also enabled the REVERSE_E_MOTOR_DIRECTION option.

mountedFilamentSensor.notes: FILAMENT SENSOR UNLOAD SETTINGS ----------------- If you have a filament sensor that is physically mounted to the machine you can enable MOUNTED_FILAMENT_SENSOR to set the unload length to 5mm to prevent filament from backing up in the sensor by uncommenting MOUNTED_FILAMENT_SENSOR

directDrivePrinter.notes: If you have a direct drive machine with a filament sensor uncomment DIRECT_DRIVE_PRINTER to decrease the unload length from 100mm to 20mm

v6Hotend.notes: THERMISTOR SETTINGS ----------------------------- If you are using an E3D V6 Hotend (or Hemera) with their cartridge thermistor (not glass version) uncomment the below line.

th3dHotendThermistor.notes: If you are using a Tough Hotend from TH3D or any thermistors TH3D sells for your hotend uncomment the below line.

knownHotendThermistor.notes: If you are using a known hotend thermistor value uncomment the below 2 lines and enter the thermistor number replacing the X after the #define KNOWN_HOTEND_THERMISTOR_VALUE

acBed.notes: If you are using an AC bed with a standalone controller (Keenovo) uncomment the below line to disable the heated bed in the firmware

reverseKnobDirection.notes: MISC -------------------------------------------- LCD Knob Direction Turning your LCD knob clockwise should move DOWN in the menus/make values increase and counter-clockwise should move UP in the menus/make values decrease If yours is behaving opposite then enable the REVERSE_KNOB_DIRECTION option below

fanFix.notes: If you have a 5015 fan that whines when under 100% speed uncomment the below line.

customPrinterName.notes: Use your own printer name - Uncomment both lines

slowerHoming.notes: If your printer is homing to the endstops hard uncomment this to change the homing speed/divisor to make it less aggressive.

reverseXMotor.notes: Axis Direction Settings If you need to reverse the direction of a motor uncomment the below option for that axis. E motor settings are below in the Extruder Settings Section

xtenderE3300.notes: ENDER XTENDER KIT SETTINGS ---------------------- Ender Xtender Kits for Ender 3/3 Pro/3 V2
